#Text=Berthold II of Landsberg
#Text=Bertold of Landsberg ( before 1464 – 4 May 1502 at the castle in Rotenburg an der Wümme ) was bishop of Verden .
#Text=He was also Bishop of Hildesheim as Berthold II .
#Text=Life
#Text=Ascent to bishop of Verden
#Text=Berthold descended from the Lower Saxon Landsberg family ( not to be confused with the Westphalian family of the same name ) .
#Text=His father was Ulrich of Landsberg .
#Text=He studied Law and obtained his JD degree .
#Text=He became a canon in Verden and became a dean in 1464 .
#Text=From 1468 , he administered the bishopric on behalf of Bishop John III of Asel , who suffered from ill health .
#Text=In 1470 , the cathedral chapter urged John III to abdicate and elected Berthold as his successor . His election was confirmed by Pope Paul II .
#Text=Bishop of Hildesheim
#Text=In 1472 , Berthold and the city of Hildesheim support the candidacy of his cousin Henning of Hus as the next bishop of Hildesheim , against several other candidates . A feud ensued .
#Text=Henning was unable to prevail against the provost and the local nobility .
#Text=After another was with Brunswick and Hesse , he withdrew his candidacy in favour if Berthold .
#Text=Berthold 's appointment was confirmed by the pope and the pope also gave Berthold permission to continue to administer Verden .
#Text=Great feud
#Text=He tried to the financial problems of his bishopric with new taxes .
#Text=In 1484 , this led to a serious conflict with the city of Hildesheim , known as the " Great Feud " .
#Text=The citizens of Hildesheim even went so far as to take some of their bishop 's vassals prisoner .
#Text=Berthold countered with ecclesiastical punishments , such as anathema and interdict .
#Text=Nevertheless , the city prevailed .
#Text=As a result , the citizens began to strengthen the city 's fortifications .
#Text=Berthold ordered the city to revert the city wall to their previous size , but the city refused .
#Text=War broke out again , with both sides plundering and looting the enemy 's territory .
#Text=In 1486 , their differences were settled and a peace treaty was agreed .
#Text=Nevertheless , tensions remained .
#Text=Foreign and domestic policies
#Text=Berthold concluded a treaty of alliance for a twenty-year period with Duke William I of Brunswick-Wolfenbüttel , who had been his predecessor 's greatest enemy .
#Text=However , it soon became clear that William would not support him in his conflicts with the local nobility .
#Text=Several North German cities concluded an alliance against their princes ;
#Text=Hildesheim was among them .
#Text=In 1483 , the cities of Brunswick and Hildesheim defeated Duke Henry VII of Brunswick-Lüneburg at Bleckenstedt in 1483 .
#Text=In 1488 , Berthold travelled to Rome to object to an unjustified papal ban against the bishoprics of Verden and Hildesheim .
#Text=He never managed to get the local nobility under control .
#Text=In 1500 , a nobleman from the Schwichelt family convinced the pope to pronounce a ban against the church in Hildesheim again .
#Text=In 1493 , he concluded an alliance for a twenty-year period with archbishop Henry II of Bremen .
#Text=However , Henry 's successor John III cancelled this alliance .
#Text=Promoting religion and culture
#Text=Because of the unsettled conditions in Hildesheim , Berthold resided mostly in the castle of Rotenburg an der Wümme in the Bishopric of Verden .
#Text=He supported church activities .
#Text=He patronized the cult of the Eucharist and the worship of Saint Anne and the patron saint of the diocese .
#Text=During his reign , the monasteries of Isenhagen , Ringelheim and Grauhof were reformed .
#Text=The construction of the nave of Verden Cathedral began during his reign .
#Text=Berthold died on 4 May 1502 and was buried in Verden Cathedral .
#Text=A cast bronze grave stone has been preserved to this day .
